Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
cd ~/SuperNET/iguana/exchanges
nano passphrase   # export passphrase="YOUR PASS PHRASE HERE"
# start marketmaker
./client

# than you should see at some point
# userpass.(cXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXxxxx6)
# copy that one and save it in userpass export userpass="cXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX"


#open new terminal

nano userpass

# now drop your claim file from the website in ./SuperNET/iguana/DB/
# than execute 

./claim

#that should claim your deposit.
# if the deposit is exactly 10 KMD you are not receiving rewards as it was to be >10 ( because of trx fee)

#I Hope it helps if not let me know I can claim it for you but I need the passphrase which is not the purpose of this exercise.
#also SHossain has done it for some people if so just make sure it does not have funds in it.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: there are some guys talking about DEX on twitter, somewhat technical so not sure if I can chime in it

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: can FR nodes do fruntrunning?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: this one: https://twitter.com/ercwl/status/1050035658146889728

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I can reply something tomorrow

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: barterDEX uses a broadcast protocol so all nodes know about all offers in realtime. seems hard to front run that

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: understood and replied

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: ok he now said "That's only if first-seen rule is honored, and there is currently no proven way to force nodes to honor it"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: each client sends to multiple FR nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so, yes the first node could refuse to relay, but it would gain only a few milliseconds advantage and only if they were the first of the N to receive it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, the protcol extends the time the auction is open for up to 30 seconds with a minimum of 3 seconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I dont think there needs to be any complicated proof that 3 seconds time an order is open for (at minimum) is enough to totally negate any few millisecond advantage the first node gains

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: thanks, perfect answer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: who is it that makes these type of "DEX

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: is impossible to be fair arguments?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: he's a developer with quite a following in btc/eth circles

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so, i wonder how he responds to my 3 seconds is a lot of time compared to a few milliseconds response

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe I am just not smart enough to understand why it doesnt work

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I'll report what he answers

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: this from a another guy: "what do relay nodes do if there's conflicting info?"

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: "i.e. 1) sorting of who went first is different from different relayers 2) orders are conflicting for same user (buy 5 AND by 10 but can only afford one of them) "

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all the requests are signed by the one making the request

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is broadcast to all that are online (via redundant relay nodes whose sole purpose is to relay orders)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the ones interested respond (with a signed offer)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the requestor evaluates all incoming signed offers and accepts the one that it wants

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it doesnt matter who went first

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: orders cant conflict for the same user, as the utxo needed are specified in the offer. if any detail is different, it is a different offer

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: the other guy seems satisfied with the answers, Eric didn't reply
